general.description:
Welcome to the trivia bot! This is a open-source Discord bot designed to allow users to upload and play trivia question sets right inside Discord! Below is a quickstart guide that should cover the basics. If you need more information on a particular command, use `/info command:<command_name>` to pull up more detailed information.

### Creating new trivia sets.
Currently, the bot supports importing trivia sets from a `.docx` file using the `/adddoc` command, Google Sheets using the `/addsheet` command, and Quizlet using the `/addquizlet` command. For `.docx` files and Google Sheets, you'll need to format the sheet correctly. The info page for the respective commands should provide you with instructions and a template.

### Removing Question Sets
Remove a question set using the `/removeset` command. Note that you must either be a server administrator the owner of the question set in order to successfully remove a set.

### Looking Up Question Sets
The Discord bot provides you two ways to look up uploaded question sets. First, the `/listsets` command will list out up to 10 question sets and their authors that match your search. For more detailed information on a question set, use `/setinfo name:<set_name>` (this is case-sensitive).

### Playing Trivia
To start a text-channel game of trivia, use the `/start` command. You have many customizable parameters including the question set to play, the number of teams, and whether or not you lose points. More is soon to come!

And with that, you should be good to go! If you still have questions, once again, you can run the `/info` command on other commands for more detailed information.

adddoc.description:
Add a question set from a `.docx` file.

**IMPORTANT** - Questions should be formatted in the following manner (any italics, underlining, or bolding will be ignored):
```Q: Question 1
A: Answer 1

Q: Question 2
A: Answer 2

...```
**Do not** create a new line (pressing the enter key) in the middle of a question/answer. It will not be counted.
- To accept multiple multiple answers, separate your answers with the `|` (vertical bar) character.
- To ask a multi-part question, use `This is a # part question. ` before your question. Note that this is punctuation-sensitive and the `#` must be the numeric digit from 2-9, not the word.
- To include an image in your question, use `!!img[URL]` before the `Q:` in your question.

For example, ```!!img[https://bolivia.png]Q: This is a 2 part question. What are the capitals of Bolivia?

A: La Paz | Santa Cruz```
For a formatted example, see https://tinyurl.com/triviabotislamgeog.

fields.name: Title `(required)` -
fields.value: The name you wish to give to the question set. This must be unused in the current list of question sets and unique to the new set.

fields.name: Description `(required)` -
fields.value: The description to add to the question set. This should provide a meaningful summary of what the question set tests as well as specific instructions in how to answer each question.

fields.name: File `(required)` -
fields.value: The `.docx` file you wish to upload. Note that the file must be less than 1 MB in size to be processed.

addquizlet.description:
Add a question set from Quizlet, given a valid quizlet URL of the form `https://quizlet.com/<id>/<name>`.

**NOTE** - Questions are by default assigned to the `term` (front) and answers are assigned to the `definition` (back) of the flashcard. To flip, use the `flip` parameter. Images are currently not supported at this time.

fields.name: Title `(required)` -
fields.value: The name you wish to give to the question set. This must be unused in the current list of question sets and unique to the new set.

fields.name: Description `(required)` -
fields.value: The description to add to the question set. This should provide a meaningful summary of what the question set tests as well as specific instructions in how to answer each question.

fields.name: URL `(required)`
fields.value: The URL associated with the Quizlet question set you wish to add.

fields.name: Flip `(optional)` -
fields.value: Whether you wish to flip how the question set treats the fronts/backs of flashcards as questions or answers (default - false: questions are the front, answers are the back).

addsheet.description:
Add a question set from Google Sheets, given a valid Google Sheets URL of the form `https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/<id>`.

**IMPORTANT** - For formatting, leave the first row blank. Questions are treated as the first column of each row and answers for each question are scanned on separate columns for the rest of the row.
- To accept multiple answers, put each answer in a separate column on the question's row.
- To ask a multi-part question, preface your question with `This is a # part question. `. Note that this is punctuation-sensitive and the `#` must be the numeric digit from 2-9, not the word.
- To include an image in your question, use `!!img[URL]` before your question.

For example, `!!img[https://bolivia.png]This is a 2 part question. What is the capital of Bolivia?` would include both an image and be a multi-part question.

For a template, see https://tinyurl.com/triviabotsheets.
For a formatted example, see https://tinyurl.com/triviabotuspres.

info.description: The `/info` command provides with useful info about the bot and commands such as the `/info` command that provides you with useful info about the bot and commands such as the `/info` command that provides you with useful info about the bot and commands such as the `/info` command...

fields.name: Command `(optional)` -
fields.value: The command you wish to learn more about. If left blank, provides you with general information about the bot.

listsets.description: Provides a page of up to 10 question set name-owner pairs to play. If a query is given, provides up to 10 question set name-owner pairs matching the query.

fields.name: Page `(optional)` -
fields.value: The page of the list you wish to start at. If left blank, starts at page 1.

fields.name: Title `(optional)` -
fields.value: The name you wish to filter by (i.e. 'Capitals'). Only question sets that have a similar name or contain this option will be displayed. If left blank, shows all question sets.

ping.description: Pings the bot. If successful, the bot should respond with a `Pong!`

setinfo.description: Provides more detailed metadata about a question set.

fields.name: Title `(required)` -
fields.value: The name of the question set you wish to request data for.

removeset.description:
Removes a question set from the question pool.
**NOTE** - You must either be a server administrator or the owner of the question set in order to do so. You will receive an error otherwise.

fields.name: Title `(required)` -
fields.value: The name of the question set you wish to remove.

startgame.description: Starts a game of trivia given the parameters. Only one game may be active per channel at a time.

fields.name: Question Set `(optional)` -
fields.value: The name of the question set you wish to play. If left blank, chooses a random question set for you. If no matches are found, errors instead.

fields.name: Shuffle `(optional)` -
fields.value: Whether or not to shuffle the questions from the original order in the question set. If left blank, shuffles the questions.

fields.name: teams `(optional)` -
fields.value: The number of teams you wish to play the game. If left blank, only 1 team is permitted. The number of teams supported are between 1-4 (inclusive).

fields.name: Lose Points `(optional)` -
fields.value: Whether or not incorrect answers or timing out of an answer loses points in the game. If left blank, incorrect and answer time outs will lose points.
